KH.content: khōra never reached, broached [entamer?], touched, exhausted: not subject, not subjectile
KH.linkedContent: khōra never reached, broached [entamer?], touched, exhausted: not subject, not subjectile

KH.content: a virginity rebellious against anthropomorphism, not order of eidos or mimemes
KH.linkedContent: a virginity rebellious against anthropomorphism, not order of eidos or mimemes

GOD.content: tremble in fear of unpredictable, unforeseeable, the untouchability of the arrival (tremo, tromeō, tromos, tremendus), enigma of trembling and tears, what are they metaphors or figures for?
GOD.linkedContent: tremble in fear of unpredictable, unforeseeable, the untouchability of the arrival (tremo, tromeō, tromos, tremendus), enigma of trembling and tears, what are they metaphors or figures for?

TB.content: Benjamin’s untouchable (unberührbar) reminds Derrida of the hymen, of the wedding gown more visibly
TB.linkedContent: Benjamin’s untouchable (unberührbar) reminds Derrida of the hymen, of the wedding gown more visibly

TB.content: untouchable: fascinates, orients work of translator

text will be even more virgin, intact, after passage of translation: hymen, sign of virginity, more jealous of itself after the other hymen, the contract signed, marriage consummated (untouchable remnant remains intact)
TB.linkedContent: text will be even more virgin, intact, after passage of translation: hymen, sign of virginity, more jealous of itself after the other hymen, the contract signed, marriage consummated (untouchable remnant remains intact)

TB.content: if axiom “there is no translation of translation” were broken, one would touch, and one must not, the untouchable of the untouchable (that which guarantees originality to the original)
TB.linkedContent: if axiom “there is no translation of translation” were broken, one would touch, and one must not, the untouchable of the untouchable (that which guarantees originality to the original)

TN.content: how to touch untouchable? > la hantise of thought of touch—ou la pensée comme hantise du toucher
TN.linkedContent: how to touch untouchable? > la hantise of thought of touch—ou la pensée comme hantise du toucher

TN.content: can one figure an untouchable extension? difficult except for intelligible extension w/out body (Descartes, Kant) or insensible sensible (Hegel, Marx)
TN.linkedContent: can one figure an untouchable extension? difficult except for intelligible extension w/out body (Descartes, Kant) or insensible sensible (Hegel, Marx)

TN.content: Psyche the untouchable, and not only for others

TN.content: penser le toucher en touchant à l’intouchable > injunction of impossible

TN.content: for Nancy, always about touching the limit, the extreme, tip, point, that which can’t be touched

TN.content: living moment of life an interiorization or expulsion? becoming-tangible of untouchable or an idealization?
TN.linkedContent: living moment of life an interiorization or expulsion? becoming-tangible of untouchable or an idealization?

TN.content: “this” and “here” of body (its sublimating idealization) makes it inaccessible to touch > an anesthesia of anesthesia, euthanasia contract
TN.linkedContent: “this” and “here” of body (its sublimating idealization) makes it inaccessible to touch > an anesthesia of anesthesia, euthanasia contract

TN.content: law of law > law of tact: must touch w/out touching, ne pas toucher [touch/tamper] à la chose même, & 1st of all—the law itself, the untouchable > kept at a distance by the gaze (regard), respect law rather than person, respect law as the cause of respect
TN.linkedContent: law of law > law of tact: must touch w/out touching, ne pas toucher [touch/tamper] à la chose même, & 1st of all—the law itself, the untouchable > kept at a distance by the gaze (regard), respect law rather than person, respect law as the cause of respect

TN.content: touchable-untouchable, untouchable right on/at (reste à même) the touchable, could only be announced if before any religion, cult, prohibition
TN.linkedContent: touchable-untouchable, untouchable right on/at (reste à même) the touchable, could only be announced if before any religion, cult, prohibition

TN.content: history of untouchable: immune, sound, safe, “sauf—le toucher”
untouchable, the excess of inaccessible beyond, the origin of figural fiction: le toucher
TN.linkedContent: untouchable, the excess of inaccessible beyond, the origin of figural fiction: le toucher

TN.content: always writing a story, tangent touches line/surface w/out intersection, a tangent touches one point, point is nothing, a limit w/out depth or surface, untouchable even as a figure
TN.linkedContent: always writing a story, tangent touches line/surface w/out intersection, a tangent touches one point, point is nothing, a limit w/out depth or surface, untouchable even as a figure

TN.content: touch is quasi-transcendental-ontologization, quasi because touchable of touch gives itself over as untouchable (se donne comme intouchable)—figuring, fictionalizing itself
TN.linkedContent: touch is quasi-transcendental-ontologization, quasi because touchable of touch gives itself over as untouchable (se donne comme intouchable)—figuring, fictionalizing itself

TN.content: letter (touchable), spirit (untouchable), Jews/Christians—who touches more? Hegel’s hardness of Jews
what one doesn’t touch is part of what we call touch, and a part greater than the whole it designates; intangible (pas-pouvoir-toucher) [capacity], untouchable (ne-pas-devoir-toucher) [ethics]
TN.linkedContent: what one doesn’t touch is part of what we call touch, and a part greater than the whole it designates; intangible (pas-pouvoir-toucher) [capacity], untouchable (ne-pas-devoir-toucher) [ethics]

TN.content: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)
TN.linkedContent: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)

TN.content: one would also have to integrate the rhetoric, plus qu’une rhétorique quand elle franchit à chaque figure the limits btwn sensible/intelligible—finding itself on both sides of the limit
TN.linkedContent: one would also have to integrate the rhetoric, plus qu’une rhétorique quand elle franchit à chaque figure the limits btwn sensible/intelligible—finding itself on both sides of the limit

CIN.content: why the phrase “il y a là cendre” doesn’t belong to him [Derrida] > cinder lent, given, to so many others, cinder remains virginal (the only thing he loves), in tact (intacte), the sentence doesn’t even say the cinder
